intro: Linaria viscosa f. flava, commonly known as the yellow sticky fleabane, is a variant of the sticky fleabane species native to southern Europe. It is a flowering plant in the family Scrophulariaceae, characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive tubular shape, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. Its common name reflects its sticky foliage and the yellow color of its flowers.
